e4: Switching to the new policy aligns with ethical corporate governance principles by providing transparent and accurate financial information. This fosters trust and integrity, aligning with legal standards and potentially mitigating regulatory risks and liabilities. Educating investors on this shift bridges misinterpretation, ensuring informed investment decisions while protecting vulnerable classes of investors across spheres.
e5: An ethical reporting policy ensures transparency, accuracy, and objectivity in financial disclosures. It should resist intentional biases or manipulations to present a true financial picture, while supporting stakeholders' understanding and compliance with legal standards. Disclosure of pertinent changes or contexts empowering both sophisticated and small investors encourages fairness, maintaining trust and corporate responsibility.
e6: I would ask how the management plans to communicate any policy changes transparently to mitigate misunderstandings. I'd want strategies to educate investors on the new reporting approach and insights into readiness plans regarding potential regulatory scrutiny or preemptive crease perspective segmentation insights due to upcoming amendments. Also, possible impacts on near-term financing. focuses possessing dramatically credence.
